newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Daewoo mulls big SAfrica investment-paper.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo mulls big SAfrica investment-paper.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Corp is planning to expand its presence in South Africa with investments totalling more than 1.2 billion rand under consideration, the Business Day newspaper said on Wednesday.

Daewoo vice-president Byung-Ju Chang said investments being studied included non-ferrous mining requiring capital of about 500 million rand, vehicle component manufacturing and assembly worth 100 million, aluminium wheel manufacturing valued at 100 million and a 500 million plant to manufacture colour television tubes.
The television tube plant would be a joint venture with Anglo American Industrial Corp which jointly owns local consumer electronics company Daewoo Electronics.
